sentences.en: "Strike Force Three are here, sir." — "Good."
sentences.cn: “第三突击队已到这里，长官。”——“很好。”

sentences.en: A snowball struck him on the back of the head.
sentences.cn: 一个雪球打中他的后脑勺。

sentences.en: he &B{struck back at} critics who claim he is too negative.
sentences.cn: 他回击那些说他过于消极的评论家。

sentences.en: He was reluctant to strike such an undignified pose before his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 他不愿意在女友面前摆出这种有失尊严的姿态.

sentences.en: In many countries, the police are forbidden to strike.
sentences.cn: 在很多国家，警察是禁止罢工的。

sentences.en: It took thirty-five seconds for the hour to strike.
sentences.cn: 报时用了35秒钟。

sentences.en: just by finishing the race, she hopes to strike a blow for womankind.
sentences.cn: 她希望仅仅是跑完全程就可为女性争光。

sentences.en: just by finishing the race, she hopes to strike a blow for womankind.
sentences.cn: 她希望仅仅是跑完全程就可为女性争光。

sentences.en: just by finishing the race, she hopes to strike a blow for womankind.
sentences.cn: 她希望仅仅是跑完全程就可为女性争光。

sentences.en: just by finishing the race, she hopes to strike a blow for womankind.
sentences.cn: 她希望仅仅是跑完全程就可为女性争光。

sentences.en: Northbridge is a cool, calculating and clever criminal who could strike again.
sentences.cn: 诺思布里奇是个头脑冷静、诡计多端、阴险狡诈的罪犯，他可能还会犯案。

sentences.en: Our instinctive reaction when someone causes us pain is to strike back.
sentences.cn: 当被别人弄疼时我们本能的反应是反击。

sentences.en: Paul struck him a blow to the head.
sentences.cn: 保罗在他头上一击。

sentences.en: Several cars were struck by falling trees.
sentences.cn: 几辆车被倒下的树砸中。

sentences.en: She fell heavily, striking her head against the side of the boat.
sentences.cn: 她重重地摔倒，头撞在船舷上。

sentences.en: She struck him hard across the face.
sentences.cn: 她重重打了他一记耳光。

sentences.en: Strike that from the minutes.
sentences.cn: 从备忘录中将之删去。

sentences.en: striking a dramatic pose, Antonia announced that she was leaving.
sentences.cn: 安东尼娅摆了个夸张的姿势后宣布她要走了。

sentences.en: striking a dramatic pose, Antonia announced that she was leaving.
sentences.cn: 安东尼娅摆了个夸张的姿势后宣布她要走了。

sentences.en: The assassin’s bullet struck home (= hit exactly where it should ) .
sentences.cn: 暗杀者的子弹正中目标。

sentences.en: The attacker may have been waiting around for an opportunity to strike.
sentences.cn: 袭击者也许一直都在等待着动手的机会。

sentences.en: The committee has decided to strike off his name from the list.
sentences.cn: 委员会决定把他的名字从名单中除去.

sentences.en: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.cn: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

sentences.en: The killer says he will strike again.
sentences.cn: 凶手称他还会再次下手。

sentences.en: The last rays of the setting sun struck the windows.
sentences.cn: 落日的最后一缕阳光照在窗户上。

sentences.en: The movie depicting the battles and bloodshed is bound to strike home.
sentences.cn: 这部描写战斗和流血牺牲的影片一定会取得预期效果.

sentences.en: The snake coiled up, ready to strike.
sentences.cn: 那条蛇盘绕起来准备攻击。

sentences.en: They have removed all tactical nuclear missiles that could strike Europe.
sentences.cn: 他们已经拆除所有能够袭击欧洲的战术核导弹。

sentences.en: to strike somebody a glancing blow
sentences.cn: 以斜击拳击中某人

sentences.en: We must go deeper and strike at the roots of the trouble.
sentences.cn: 我们必须深入下去,抓住问题的症结所在.

sentences.en: We try to strike a balance between justice and mercy.
sentences.cn: 我们设法做到宽严并济,恩威兼施.

words.tran_cn: 显著的，突出的，惊人的；打击的；罢工的
罢工者；打击者；[军] 撞针；钟锤；叉鱼的人
罢工，打，打击（strike的过去式和过去分词）
打，打击；[劳经]罢工；敲，敲击；抓；打动；穿透
打，击；[劳经]罢工；撞击，冲击；侵袭；打动；到达

phrases.tran_cn: n. 雷击（等于lightning stroke）；闪电式罢工
(英，非正式，旧)［表示吃惊、沮丧或惊恐］哎唷

phrases.phrase: strike at the root (或 roots) of

phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式，旧)［表示惊讶、愤慨］真是见鬼
获得最大成就；达到最高目标；显出全副本领
使开始；建立起；开始演奏

phrases.phrase: strike while the iron is hot

trans.tran_en: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

trans.tran_cn: 碰撞，打，突击，侵袭，给人…印象，罢工
trans.tran_en: to hit or fall against the surface of something
to hit or fall against the surface of something

trans.tran_cn: 罢工；打，击，敲；袭击，侵袭；敲响，报时
trans.tran_en: to hit or fall against the surface of something

trans.tran_cn: 使突然想到；打，击，敲；侵袭，折磨；给…以深刻印象；发现，找到
trans.tran_en: to hit or fall against the surface of something
